# vanda

**vanda** provides an R interface to the [Victoria & Albert Museumâ€™s
Model Context Protocol (MCP) server](https://mcp.vam.ac.uk/mcp/). It
allows you to search, extract, and visualise collection data directly
from R.

## Website

View the full documentation and vignettes at:
**<https://JohnGavin.github.io/vanda/>**

## Installation

You can install the development version of vanda from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("JohnGavin/vanda")
```

## Usage

``` r
library(vanda)

# Connect (currently uses mock data if server is down)
client <- mcp_connect()

# Search
results <- mcp_search(client, "Textile")

# Visualise
vanda_visualise(results)
```

## License

MIT

# Package index

## All functions

- [`mcp_connect()`](https://JohnGavin.github.io/llm/vanda/reference/mcp_connect.md)
  : Connect to V&A MCP Server
- [`mcp_extract()`](https://JohnGavin.github.io/llm/vanda/reference/mcp_extract.md)
  : Extract Object Data
- [`mcp_search()`](https://JohnGavin.github.io/llm/vanda/reference/mcp_search.md)
  : Search V&A Collections
- [`vanda_visualise()`](https://JohnGavin.github.io/llm/vanda/reference/vanda_visualise.md)
  : Visualise Search Results
